page.title: 09Sycamore Farm,Helme.(1778)
page.content:
Sycamore farm is a small farm in the village of{Helme}.It consists of 39 acres of good pasture land carrying approximately 40 head of{beef}cattle. No crops are grown other than hay and silage for winter feed.The stables are rented out for livery.
In{spring}, fertilizer is spread on the land to ensure good crops of hay and silage in the{summer}.In late April, cattle are turned out into the field.Two crops of silage are cut,one in summer and one in{autumn.} Muck-spreading, any ploughing and reseeding are carried out. The cattle are brought in for the{winter}months and fed with silage and barley.All the hay made in the summer is sold,mainly to livery stables.
